title: Patrick Day in ‘extremely critical condition’ after brain surgery following brutal 10th-round KO against Charles Conwell
text:
Patrick Day (right) suffered a brutal 10th-round KO at the hands of Charles Conwell (Getty Images)

American boxer Patrick Day is in ‘extremely critical condition’ after he was brutally knocked out by Charles Conwell on Saturday evening.

Day was dropped twice in the fight before he was knocked out cold in the 10th round as Conwell hit him with a right hook to the temple and a left hook to the jaw.

The 27-year-old was treated in the ring for several minutes and left on a stretcher as he was rushed to hospital.

Day required emergency brain surgery but remained in a coma on Sunday evening.

Please PRAY for Patrick Day !!

He got knocked out in his fight against Charles Cornwall and is still unconscious from that KO. He was taken to the ICU and was having seizures#UFCTampa #Boxing pic.twitter.com/3zMxfB6fgb — MMA India (@MMAIndiaShow) October 13, 2019

‘Patrick Day suffered a traumatic brain injury during his bout on Saturday night,’ promoter Lou DiBella said in a statement.

‘He was rushed to Northwestern Memorial hospital where he underwent emergency surgery.

Day was knocked out cold by Conwell (SIPA USA/PA Images)

‘As of Sunday evening, Patrick is in a coma caused by the injury and is in extremely critical condition.

‘On behalf of Patrick’s team, we appreciate the outpouring of support, prayers, and offers of assistance from all corners of the boxing community.

Day was treated by paramedics in the ring (SIPA USA/PA Images)

‘Updates will be provided as circumstances change.

‘In the meantime, we ask that the privacy of Patrick and his family be respected during this difficult time.’
